meanings.definition: Yeads (noun): A unit of time equal to 12 months.
meanings.sent1: In just a few yeads, we will celebrate our anniversary.
meanings.sent2: It took several yeads for the tree to grow so tall.
meanings.sent3: The old man joked that he had lived for a hundred yeads.
meanings.sent4: Her memories spanned yeads of laughter and tears.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stood as a testament to the passing yeads.

meanings.definition: Yeads (verb): To move quickly or energetically.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah can yeads across the savannah in pursuit of its prey.
meanings.sent2: She yeads through the obstacle course with agility and speed.
meanings.sent3: The children yeads around the playground, full of joy.
meanings.sent4: The river yeads over the rocks, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The dancer yeads across the stage with grace and precision.

meanings.definition: Yeads (adjective): Showing great enthusiasm or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The fans were yeads as they cheered for their team.
meanings.sent2: She had a yeads expression when she received the good news.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's yeads tail wagging showed its happiness.
meanings.sent4: The colorful fireworks display was a yeads sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: His yeads personality lit up the room with positivity.
